item.title: Adding Xp to item on item
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[code]if(itemUsed == 4002 && otherItem == 4004) {

if(playerLevel[12] >= 70) {

deleteItem(4002, getItemSlot(4002), 1);
deleteItem(4004, getItemSlot(4004), 1);
addItem(4000, 1);
addSkillXP(EXP AMOUNT, SKILL ID));
} else {
sendMessage(“You need 70 crafting to craft the _____.”);
}
}
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Xp to item on item
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

Now I have a question on this for you, Chassy. It should look like this?:

if(((itemUsed == 4002) && (otherItem == 4004))){ if(playerLevel[12] >= 70) { deleteItem(4002, getItemSlot(4002), 1); deleteItem(4004, getItemSlot(4004), 1); addItem(4000, 1); addSkillXP(EXP AMOUNT, SKILL ID)); } else { sendMessage("You need 70 crafting to craft the _____."); }

Read full topic
item.source: Adding Xp to item on item

item.title: Adding Xp to item on item
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

if(playerLevel[#] >= 70) {

Here is a playerLevel list incase you don’t have one.

playerLevel[0] = Attack playerLevel[1] = Defence playerLevel[2] = Strength playerLevel[3] = Hitpoints playerLevel[4] = Range playerLevel[5] = Prayer playerLevel[6] = Magic playerLevel[7] = Cooking playerLevel[8] = WoodCutting playerLevel[9] = Fletching playerLevel[10] = Fishing playerLevel[11] = Firemaking playerLevel[12] = Crafting playerLevel[13] = Smithing playerLevel[14] = Mining playerLevel[15] = Herblore playerLevel[16] = Agility playerLevel[17] = Thieving playerLevel[18] = Slayer playerLevel[19] = Farming playerLevel[20] = Runecrafting

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Xp to item on item
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

I would make it look like this:

if(((itemUsed == 4002) && (otherItem == 4004))){ deleteItem(4002, getItemSlot(4002), 1); deleteItem(4004, getItemSlot(4004), 1); addItem(4000, 1); addSkillXP(EXP AMOUNT, SKILL ID)); }

Just incase you didn’t know, and if you use that, please tell me if it worked! I’m not that good of a coder, and I want to know if that will work.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @r_r_r r r r
item.description:
@r_r_r wrote:

Ok so I got this code added to my case 53 but I want it to add xp to a skill.

if(((itemUsed == 4002) && (otherItem == 4004))){ deleteItem(4002, getItemSlot(4002), 1); deleteItem(4004, getItemSlot(4004), 1); addItem(4000, 1); }
What would I do to add xp to a skill.
